str2: Thus, so, in this manner. Or (referring to what precedes or follows).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To withdraw from, take leave of, renounce, send away.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Reflexive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
Verb - Present Participle Active - Dative Neuter Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
